data.title: Not my favorite Perkins
data.text: Usually get cold food here and the staff attitude could use a tune up.   I quit going to this restaurant.  Avoid it like the plague.

data.title: Love the Tomato Basil Soup !!
data.text:
I chose the Perfect Trio where you have a choice of three items from four categories: 1) bowl of soup 2) half sandwiches 3) side salads 4) Pies. 
My choice was tomato basil soup, a half BLT sandwich, and lemon meringue pie. Everything was awesome, the pie sweet and tangy lemon, the BLT fresh and crisp, but the soup was absolutely perfect. 
Service by Debbie was terrific.  Thanks again Perkins @ Plymouth for a great meal.

data.title: Medicocre food and weird service
data.text: Came in just after midnight and the place was virtually empty. Several parties came in shortly after we had placed our order and the place seemed to suddenly be frozen in some kind of weird limbo. After 45 minutes, we asked what had happened to our order (poached eggs, pancakes and an omelette) and were told it was not ready. After an hour we were served part of the order (no poached eggs) and the waitress said the food would be free. The omelette was greasy and flavorless but the pancakes were okay.

data.title: Great food and service as well!
data.text: Met family here for lunch Sunday. The restaurant was pretty busy but we got seated almost immediately. We actually had two servers as one was in training and they were both excellent. I noticed they had a new general manager on board, he was out and about on the floor. Very personable and friendly as well. So good to see at this location!

data.title: Waited 10 min to get seated.
data.text:
My wife and I went to Perkins last night for dinner around 9pm.  We waited 10 minutes to get seated.  During that time, the cashier told another customer, how her fiancé had to cook till 6am, due to employee walkout.  

Another employee told us it would be one moment.  After 10 minutes of waiting, we left.

data.title: Not what I expect from Perkins
data.text:
It was Father's Day so we were not surprised that we had to wait. However, we waited while people who came after us were seated. Our server was Donna. She was ok but we had to wait to get silverware and my husband asked twice for oj. My omelet was barely warm as were my pancakes. I went to another table for a salt shaker rather than wait for her to return.  She was very prompt in dropping off the check.
This will not be our choice the next time we're in this area.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: I love the make over and the food was good. I made up a crispy chicken blt with fries and it was great.

data.title: Great food, service not so much
data.text: We had a bit of a wait because of the after-church crowd. Unfortunately, not nearly enough seating to accommodate the amount of people waiting. It was a bit of a cluster, in fact! All our food was delicious, but our server wasn't too impressive. She brought our coffee cups and a thermos, but didn't even pour our first cups. Oh well, we're capable. Took our order, delivered our order, and delivered our check. No extra check-ins. We had to ask if we could order dessert, as she never did. Again, the food was good, and that goes a long way.

data.title: Mediocre service and food not so good today!
data.text: Haven't been here for several months. It seemed to be busier than usual for 11:30 am. We noticed that even though there were many open tables and booths, that there were several parties waiting in the lobby to be seated. They did not have a host/hostess at the podium. There seemed to be a manager who was doing too many jobs. Cashier, bakery orders, seating people and then he would disapear into the kitchen. There was not always someone up front to greet those who came in to dine. The servers were seating people as well which took them away from taking care of customers like us. It took almost 25 minutes for our food to come out after ordering. That was difficult as we had small children with us. I ordered a skillet meal which came on a plate and was very dry except for the little gravy on top. There used to be super food and super management at this location but I've noticed over the past year that both have gone down hill. Maybe corporate should look into it!

data.title: Stop asking me to review things
data.text: I like the omlette with feta cheese and spinach. Have had it several times at different Perkins restaurants.

data.title: Solid Lunch
data.text: On a bit of an atkins style diet so the bacon and ham omlette was perfect.  Wish I would have thought of Perkins for lunch earler.

data.title: Hey its Perkins
data.text: Typical Perkins, fast friendly service at good prices. It great they are open all night too so when your craving & no one else is open you can count on Perkins.

data.title: Great food and service as well!
data.text: Received an email recently that this location had been remodeled plus a 20% off coupon so decided to check it out. Yes there have been great improvements made at this "older" location. New flooring in entry, new furniture including tables, chairs, booths etc. The layout did not change at all, but looks really nice now with the new furnishings etc. Didn't check out the bathroom so not sure if it was included in the recent renovation.

data.title: breakfast time
data.text: enjoyed a great breakfast for me and my fiancé. it was cooked in a timely manager and was hot and ready upon takeout. the manager was very nice and helpful.

data.title: Renovating but OK - typical Perkins
data.text:
A typical Perkins - good food, good menu, good prices.
Renovating restaurant but OK
Pork chop dinner with mashed potatoes, brown gravy & corn was very good. A scoop of ice cream with hot fudge topping was really good.

data.title: I wish we had this in MA
data.text: I love their fried Pickles.  Meals are about ten dollars each.  Appetizers are half-off 9pm-midnight, and in the summer they are open til 3am. Pie is the best.  Try the Wildberry if you can get a slice.

data.title: Friendly staff, good food and fast service
data.text: Pulled in late from a long ride and needed to eat. Walked in, was greeted with a smile and seated quickly. The waitress was friendly and helpful and our food showed up quick and tasty. Prices were great and my belly was happy.

data.title: Amazing breakfast choices!
data.text:
I loved the breakfast options at this place.

The fruits on the food were great, but the cakes werent so great.

The staff is very helpful and helped me make my choice. It wasnt too far from my hotel but I still made it to this place just once.

data.title: Just As Expected
data.text: Convenient location just off the highway.  Customary good breakfast; good service. Good for short business breakfast or lunch, or family meal anytime of the day.

data.title: Late night, one server
data.text: In spite of the fact that it was after midnight on Thanksgiving (actually Friday am) and there was only one server that we could see - we got pretty good service.
